metadata.title: CVE-2019-17626 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
ReportLab through 3.5.26 allows remote code execution because oftoColor(eval(arg)) in colors.py, as demonstrated by a crafted XML documentwith '<span color="' followed by arbitrary Python code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-renderpm - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python-reportlab - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python-reportlab-accel - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-renderpm - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-reportlab - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-reportlab-accel - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-reportlab package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1').
